title: Di4cod
author: Di4cod
content: Hello, dear members of Bitcointalk forum!I am looking for a partner for an interesting cryptocurrency project. Details about this project can be provided only in private messages. If you are interested in cooperation, please write me in private messages and we will discuss the details of the project and possibilities of cooperation.Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to your messages!

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: You need to be a little more specific, what kind of cooperation? Are you looking for developers, marketers, investors, or something else? Also, I'm sure many forum members would appreciate at least a hint or general information about the project before they decide to reach out.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on October 22, 2023, 10:26:49 PMYou need to be a little more specific, what kind of cooperation? Are you looking for developers, marketers, investors, or something else? Also, I'm sure many forum members would appreciate at least a hint or general information about the project before they decide to reach out.I can assume that the OP has an idea that will bring millions of dollars in profit, but this requires an investor willing to pay for the banquet. And I can also assume that he will not find such an investor here on the forum, since such ideas are generated too often by newcomers.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: @OP, this isn't how you find a partner for a crypto project that you're working on. Based on the looks, you're likely looking for a partner(investor) that's willing to fund you for the idea you have. Deets needed to be PMed, why is that? If that's the condition you have, no one will message you. To save your time and everyone's time, just write all the details on your post of what you're looking for and what your project is. That will be a big time saver for you and everyone if it's a real thing or not.

comments.author: Di4cod
comments.body: Quote from: sunsilk on October 23, 2023, 09:08:07 PM@OP, this isn't how you find a partner for a crypto project that you're working on. Based on the looks, you're likely looking for a partner(investor) that's willing to fund you for the idea you have. Deets needed to be PMed, why is that? If that's the condition you have, no one will message you. To save your time and everyone's time, just write all the details on your post of what you're looking for and what your project is. That will be a big time saver for you and everyone if it's a real thing or not.I am looking for a partner to support me in realizing a cryptocurrency project that I deeply believe has the potential to change the world. I consider myself to be extremely honest and dedicated to the cryptocurrency world for over three years. It is important to me that the partner trusts me, as I have quality and detailed information about the project that I am willing to provide personally. I am ready to provide full details, discuss strategy and partnership. I want to create a mutually beneficial partnership and a successful project that can have a significant impact on the world.

comments.author: Di4cod
comments.body: Quote from: tvplus006 on October 23, 2023, 08:52:56 PMQuote from: FatFork on October 22, 2023, 10:26:49 PMYou need to be a little more specific, what kind of cooperation? Are you looking for developers, marketers, investors, or something else? Also, I'm sure many forum members would appreciate at least a hint or general information about the project before they decide to reach out.I can assume that the OP has an idea that will bring millions of dollars in profit, but this requires an investor willing to pay for the banquet. And I can also assume that he will not find such an investor here on the forum, since such ideas are generated too often by newcomers.Okay, well, then where can I find

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 24, 2023, 02:27:57 PMQuote from: tvplus006 on October 23, 2023, 08:52:56 PMQuote from: FatFork on October 22, 2023, 10:26:49 PMYou need to be a little more specific, what kind of cooperation? Are you looking for developers, marketers, investors, or something else? Also, I'm sure many forum members would appreciate at least a hint or general information about the project before they decide to reach out.I can assume that the OP has an idea that will bring millions of dollars in profit, but this requires an investor willing to pay for the banquet. And I can also assume that he will not find such an investor here on the forum, since such ideas are generated too often by newcomers.Okay, well, then where can I findThrough a loan at the bank, where you will need to deliver a collateral or guarantee that borrowed money is going to be paid back in time and with interest. Nobody is going to give you money without any assurance they are going to be paid back in return, doesn't matter how good your idea may look. It's too easy to make wonderful promises on this digital world where people don't have faces, IDs or addresses, because if something goes wrong, they simply vanish on the unknown to never come back again.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 24, 2023, 01:58:37 PMI am looking for a partner to support me in realizing a cryptocurrency project that I deeply believe has the potential to change the world. I consider myself to be extremely honest and dedicated to the cryptocurrency world for over three years. It is important to me that the partner trusts me, as I have quality and detailed information about the project that I am willing to provide personally. I am ready to provide full details, discuss strategy and partnership. I want to create a mutually beneficial partnership and a successful project that can have a significant impact on the world.If your project can really change the world, then you need to contact companies such as Binance Labs, Coinbase Ventures, a16z or directly to Vitalik Buterin. Their immediate task is to select promising projects and further investment. If they refuse you, do not hesitate to contact me again and I will write to you a few more companies that may be interested in your project.

comments.author: wallet4bitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 24, 2023, 01:58:37 PMQuote from: sunsilk on October 23, 2023, 09:08:07 PM@OP, this isn't how you find a partner for a crypto project that you're working on. Based on the looks, you're likely looking for a partner(investor) that's willing to fund you for the idea you have. Deets needed to be PMed, why is that? If that's the condition you have, no one will message you. To save your time and everyone's time, just write all the details on your post of what you're looking for and what your project is. That will be a big time saver for you and everyone if it's a real thing or not.I am looking for a partner to support me in realizing a cryptocurrency project that I deeply believe has the potential to change the world. I consider myself to be extremely honest and dedicated to the cryptocurrency world for over three years. It is important to me that the partner trusts me, as I have quality and detailed information about the project that I am willing to provide personally. I am ready to provide full details, discuss strategy and partnership. I want to create a mutually beneficial partnership and a successful project that can have a significant impact on the world.I understand that you have good motives and sincerely honest and also a reliable person, but you carry a tag of a newbie and there are loads of disadvantages that goes with that, the trust level from forum members will be psychologically low and again, leaving people entirely out of the idea makes it avoidable. If you want to have partners, even in the conventional world, you have to give an introduction of the solution and how its business for your partner.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: Quote from: tvplus006 on October 23, 2023, 08:52:56 PMQuote from: FatFork on October 22, 2023, 10:26:49 PMYou need to be a little more specific, what kind of cooperation? Are you looking for developers, marketers, investors, or something else? Also, I'm sure many forum members would appreciate at least a hint or general information about the project before they decide to reach out.I can assume that the OP has an idea that will bring millions of dollars in profit, but this requires an investor willing to pay for the banquet. And I can also assume that he will not find such an investor here on the forum, since such ideas are generated too often by newcomers.I would not be investing my time and effort on something like this...no matter if this can be bringing me millions which I am doubting in the first place. To look for partners, one must be presenting the idea and concept well and make sure that its viability and profitability as well as sustainability are not questionable. And for sure, a newbie here still lacks some level of credibility. However, am still wishing OP the success he is looking for.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 24, 2023, 01:58:37 PMQuote from: sunsilk on October 23, 2023, 09:08:07 PM@OP, this isn't how you find a partner for a crypto project that you're working on. Based on the looks, you're likely looking for a partner(investor) that's willing to fund you for the idea you have. Deets needed to be PMed, why is that? If that's the condition you have, no one will message you. To save your time and everyone's time, just write all the details on your post of what you're looking for and what your project is. That will be a big time saver for you and everyone if it's a real thing or not.I am looking for a partner to support me in realizing a cryptocurrency project that I deeply believe has the potential to change the world. I consider myself to be extremely honest and dedicated to the cryptocurrency world for over three years. It is important to me that the partner trusts me, as I have quality and detailed information about the project that I am willing to provide personally. I am ready to provide full details, discuss strategy and partnership. I want to create a mutually beneficial partnership and a successful project that can have a significant impact on the world.While it is important for you to be trusted by your potential partner. The thing here is that, you're at their favor whether you should be trusted or not since they're the ones that will invest on you, into your project if there will ever be.I am not that partner to say so that let's just be clear with that. But if you can provide all of those details and you're not going to put that on public since you're looking on serious partners, you might have hard time in finding the right one through the forum.Because it's easy to say all of those qualities that you're good, expert, honest, etc in words through the internet. But to prove that is another thing.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 24, 2023, 01:58:37 PMI am looking for a partner to support me in realizing a cryptocurrency project that I deeply believe has the potential to change the world. I consider myself to be extremely honest and dedicated to the cryptocurrency world for over three years. It is important to me that the partner trusts me, as I have quality and detailed information about the project that I am willing to provide personally. I am ready to provide full details, discuss strategy and partnership. I want to create a mutually beneficial partnership and a successful project that can have a significant impact on the world.Let's assume that I am this partner. How will I trust you when your account was created three days ago with a Newbie membership, and you have only posted three posts so far? In addition to that you did not mention your role in the project or the budget you have, and you did not provide any proof of your experiences and skills that would qualify you to create a project that will change the world. I don't want to be disappointing to you, but your request for a partner means that he will invest his funds with you, and it could be thousands of dollars, and you will be in control of it if I am not mistaken.So, What guarantees and assurances will you provide him to ensure that his funds are placed in the right hands, that you are a truly honest person, and that your project will ultimately succeed? I have seen many projects launched that failed to achieve their goals due to market conditions, budget constraints, and a lack of investor interest, leading to their currencies becoming shitcoins in investors' wallets in the end.

comments.author: krishnaverma
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 22, 2023, 10:06:17 PMHello, dear members of Bitcointalk forum!I am looking for a partner for an interesting cryptocurrency project. Details about this project can be provided only in private messages. If you are interested in cooperation, please write me in private messages and we will discuss the details of the project and possibilities of cooperation.Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to your messages!What are you looking for in the partner? Investment or skills ? Also, do your own due diligence before going with anyone from an online forum because number of online scams is on rise.

comments.author: Venik
comments.body: Looking for a partner on a forum is kinda dangerous. You either might be scammed, or you're the one trying to scam someone. If you need someone - make a normal job vacancy.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Imagine if you are the reader of this thread of yours. Will you really PM yourself just upon reading all that simple message? I doubt that. At least put something that will make the invitation more appealing to an investor's eyes. You want them to just PM you because you have an idea. I don't think you can make someone do that with just that. It's not like this is 2008 anymore where people would try to risk it by messaging anyone just so they could get a partner for their bright idea. People nowadays are wiser, they know about cryptocurrencies, they know about technology, so if you have an idea give some clues of how genuine it is, and maybe you will find a partner. You do not have to give all the information and I doubt anyone could just steal it from you while giving out clues. You could always edit the opening post to make it better.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 22, 2023, 10:06:17 PMHello, dear members of Bitcointalk forum!I am looking for a partner for an interesting cryptocurrency project. Details about this project can be provided only in private messages. If you are interested in cooperation, please write me in private messages and we will discuss the details of the project and possibilities of cooperation.Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to your messages!You're not going to get a partner here unless you give us even small details on what you're platform is all about you do not even mention the qualifications of people you're looking for possible partnership with, this is not a good business ethic if you're posting a job, a partnership or even hiring you should put up details on what you're looking for and details about the platform, so people will not waste their time asking.I had a worse experience with this guy who posted a job without details and after I asked it through private messages he wanted me to sign up for a faucet site, I just wasted my time sending him a message, the reason so many posters not posting details because there is referring involved.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 22, 2023, 10:06:17 PMI am looking for a partner for an interesting cryptocurrency project. Details about this project can be provided only in private messages. If you are interested in cooperation, please write me in private messages and we will discuss the details of the project and possibilities of cooperation.What kind of project? Are you looking for financial partner or strategic partnership? Its all about what kind but since you are looking for one. I can accept a dm from you and explain what kind of project you are talking about pretty sure a lots wanted to know first but isnt it much better if youll put up details in post so everyone can easily and match which one you are looking for.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 22, 2023, 10:06:17 PMI am looking for a partner for an interesting cryptocurrency project. Details about this project can be provided only in private messages. If you are interested in cooperation, please write me in private messages and we will discuss the details of the project and possibilities of cooperation.In other words, you're looking for business collaboration and possibly in other for you to be able to raise the financial assistance needed to run such, yet you're making a demand that they should write to you an application on that regards, your project have no overview, hint or any direction on what it looks like, you lack good way of making a presentable offer, yet you think a dumbass somewhere is willing to drop his money for you, waste his time and effort just to please your unaccomplished project, think about this twice.

comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: Di4cod on October 24, 2023, 02:27:57 PMQuote from: tvplus006 on October 23, 2023, 08:52:56 PMQuote from: FatFork on October 22, 2023, 10:26:49 PMYou need to be a little more specific, what kind of cooperation? Are you looking for developers, marketers, investors, or something else? Also, I'm sure many forum members would appreciate at least a hint or general information about the project before they decide to reach out.I can assume that the OP has an idea that will bring millions of dollars in profit, but this requires an investor willing to pay for the banquet. And I can also assume that he will not find such an investor here on the forum, since such ideas are generated too often by newcomers.Okay, well, then where can I findSince with your question you have basically admitted that is what you are looking for then I will give you one piece of advice, the days of easy money are coming to an end, even the scammers that are creating meme coins by a dozen do not follow this model anymore, they release their meme coins hoping that they get enough hype around their projects, but from a technical point of view everything is ready and they only need the investors to come to them, in your case you supposedly have a new idea that could according to you change the world, but ideas like that are a dime a dozen, what matters is how you actually make that idea a reality, with most developers failing at that critical step, so work on your project until it is completely ready and you can show investors what they can get, otherwise do not bother trying to get any money before you complete your project.
